src:
“Balkanski tango“ pripao Srbinu, Đoković u finalu Pariza
02 Nov 2019, 16:01 by Darko

Novak Đoković – Grigor Dimitrov 7:6(5),6:4

Novak Đoković će se u nedelju boriti za svoju petu titulu u pariskom Bersiju, kao i za očuvanje nade da godinu može da završi na prvom mestu. On je u polufinalu pobedio bugraskog tenisera, Grigora Dimitrova, sa 2:0 (7:6(5), 6:4), a igralo se sat i 38 minuta.
Bila je to jubilarna deseta pobda Srbina protiv najboljeg bugarskog igrača svih vremena, koji je Đokovića pobedio samo jednom, na Mastersu u Madridu 2013. godine. Rival, još uvek prvom teniseru sveta, u finalu biće pobednik duela Rafaela Nadala i Denisa Šapovalova.
Prvi set nije obeležila neka spektakularna igra dvojice tenisera, ali je neizvesnost oko njegovog ishoda bila maksimalna. Đoković i Dimitrov su držali svoj servis, nedozvoljavajući rivalu nijednu brejk loptu. Možda je Srbin imao malo problema u sedmom gemu, bilo je 15:30 i jedan dug poen nakon toga, ali se i iz te situacije uspešno izvukao.
Što se taj brejka tiče, Novak je prvi stekao prednost mini brejka, ali je Bugarin odmah uzvratio. Dvostruka servis greška našeg tenisera donela je Dimitrovu prednost od 5:3, a kod 5:4 imao je dva servisa za osvajanje prvog seta. Tada je odigran najvažniji poen u setu, trajao je više od 30 udaraca, a Bugarin je pogrešio kod jednog dosta lakog drajv voleja, izbacivši lopticu u aut. Od te greške nije se oporavio, pa su i naredna dva poena pripala Đokoviću koji je poveo sa 1:0, posle skoro sat vremena igre.
Nije se mnogo toga promenilo ni u drugom setu, prva četiri gema dobili su serveri, a onda se Đokoviću ukazala šansa, koju on nije ispustio. Imao je srpski teniser dve vezane brejk lopte, prvu je Dimitrov spasio servis vinerom, ali ne i drugu, posle koje je viđen prvi i jedini brejk na meču.
Do okončanja duela ponovo su gemove dobijali teniseri koji su servirali, bez neke veće drame, pa je pobeda pripala Đokoviću koji je iskoristio prvu meč loptu nakon 98 minuta igre.

POVEZANE OBJAVE
text:
Balkan Tango Appears to Serbia, Djokovic in Paris Final
02 Nov 2019, 15:01 by Darko

Novak Djokovic - Grigor Dimitrov 7: 6 (5), 6: 4

On Sunday, Novak Djokovic will fight for his fifth title at the Paris Bersi, as well as to preserve the hope that he can finish the year in the first place. He defeated Bulgarian tennis player Grigor Dimitrov in the semifinals by 2: 0 (7: 6 (5), 6: 4), which was played for an hour and 38 minutes.
It was the jubilee 10th Serbian victory against the best Bulgarian player of all time, who won Djokovic only once, at the 2013 Masters in Madrid. Rival, still the world's first tennis player, will win Rafael Nadal and Dennis Shapovalov in the final.
The first set was not marked by some spectacular play by two tennis players, but uncertainty about its outcome was maximal. Djokovic and Dimitrov kept their service, allowing no rival to break even the ball. Maybe the Serb had a little trouble in the seventh game, it was 15:30 and one long point after that, but he also successfully got out of that situation.
As for this break, Novak was the first to gain the advantage of a mini break, but the Bulgarian immediately responded. Our tennis player's double-serve error brought Dimitrov a 5: 3 advantage, and at 5: 4 he had two runs to win the first set. Then the most important point in the set was played, lasted more than 30 strokes, and the Bulgarian made a mistake on one rather easy drive of the volley, throwing the ball into the car. He did not recover from that mistake, so the next two points went to Djokovic, who led by 1-0 after almost an hour of play.
Not much has changed in the second set, the first four games were given to the servers, and then Djokovic was given a chance, which he did not miss. He had a Serbian tennis player with two tie breakers, the first to save Dimitrov a winemaker service, but not the second, after which he saw the first and only break in the match.
Until the end of the duel, the games were again served by the tennis players who served without any major drama, so the victory went to Djokovic, who used the first match after 98 minutes of play.
